page.title: 01Landscape - West Oxfordshire
page.content: The landscape is gentle and lazily hilly with a few small deciduous woods. Dotted around the countryside are sleepy villages with little activity. Narrow roads criss cross the area. Quite a lot of the minor roads are hardly used at all because no one has any need for them. It is a peaceful, quiet place, except on the B4022 which is quite busy but not with enough cars for a traffic jam. The main business is the farming of crops such as rape, wheat, barley, maize and beans. It is not an industrial place because it is in the countryside. If there was a factory you would have to take your products a long way to sell them.
